The Support-Points produced by my machine canâ€™t be transported in a normal way, because they are only virtual data. To solve this problem I developed a Flash-Memory, which can store a fixed amount of Support points independent from a machine.

This first and really simple Redstone-Memory is based on small Redstone elements which can take 2 states. These cells are very prone to physical and electrical influences, so I have covered them in a corrosion-resistant and shielding gold casing.
For the internal organization and an access to the memory module a simple Logic Chipset including a special program is all that's needed.
